description: From Middle English apesen, from Old French apeser (“to pacify, bring to peace”).

verbs.description: appease (third-person singular simple present appeases, present participle appeasing, simple past and past participle appeased)

entries.meaning: To make quiet; to calm; to reduce to a state of peace; to dispel (anger or hatred).
examples: Synonyms: calm, pacify, placate, quell, quiet, still, lull
to appease the tumult of the ocean

entries.meaning: To come to terms with; to adapt to the demands of.
examples: They appeased the angry gods with burnt offerings.
